TopicTitle: Who should the next Doctor be?

Articles.Content:
Seeing as Matt Smith is leaving Doctor who, I would like to see who people think should be next doctor. Please respect each others' (serious) suggestions, and don't flame.

I would have to say I would like to see either Brian Blessed, but he is too old, but any lines read by him would be amazing. 9 He should have played Robert Baratheon in game of Thrones), Martin Freeman, From Sherlock (Best. TV. Series. Ever.), the Hobbit and a HitchHikers guide to the Galaxy. Or possibly even Benedict Cumberbatch Who is the best actor in the universe.
I'd like to see the return of an older guy as the Doctor, as a sort of "your crazy, old, slightly demented, grandfather" personality
I've heard rumors that the next one will be female. I'd be cautious, though, it's only rumors.
Doesn't the doctor get younger with every regeneration? So eventually would he regenerate into a baby?

Doesn't the doctor get younger with every regeneration? So eventually would he regenerate into a baby?

Dr 10000 and his Sonic Rattle.

Dr 10000 and his Sonic Rattle.

I'm sure that as some split off series that could happen...

It could be worse...

I don't if any of you have seen the Sarah Jane adventures? That was a spinoff of the series, where villains went to die.

I mean, they repainted the slythereen orange and called them the blatheen.

A female Doctor could be interesting, but I'd rather see what they intend to do with Doctor Hurt first. Besides, I doubt I'd feel comfortable with a female Doctor. Fellow's always been male, and it'd just be a creepy thing to adjust to.
And also trying to get that into the plot lines how the doctor changed gender.

Indeed, it would all be highly predictable, and I frankly don't think it would be a good move for the franchise in the long run.

In the short term, it could work, though.

Much as I love Stephen Fry, he's not the Doctor, and never will be.
